intro: Matricaria segetum, commonly known as field chamomile, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flower heads with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, grass-like leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is used in aromatherapy and as a mild sedative.
